channel.title: Weird X mouse
channel.description:
Well, I'm enjoying my Linux distribution Kubuntu 7.04, and I used konqueror for a bit to get an audio driver. Suddenly, my excitement expires when I click the download button. That familiar X symbol appears as my mouse icon, but with a grey circle... I click and click EVERYWHERE, and nothing happens. Right click, left click, middle click, even scroll, nothing happens... However, I can still move it... What more? I find this page with a box following my mouse. I have to keep pushing CTRL for it to get near the circled X.
Is this some kind of self-virus, or a feature that I'm not aware of?

item.title: Weird X mouse
item.dc:creator: @Rajae Rajae
item.description:
@Rajae wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Sounds like JavaScript on the webpage you were on to me. Remember the URL?

Yea, this is the URL. I was trying to download an audio driver for linux (before I found out about ALSA).

Read full topic

item.title: Weird X mouse
item.dc:creator: @Sensored3 Sensored3
item.description:
@Sensored3 wrote:

Remove that video driver you just got and see if it fixes the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Weird X mouse
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

juju:

okay, i’ve heard of lots of people with this problem, what u need to do is get your windows repair cd, place it into your coffee cup holder and then reboot, when your machine starts up you can reinstall windows and get your machine working properly again.

lol, this is also LINUX not a windows problem

Read full topic

item.title: Weird X mouse
item.dc:creator: @Rajae Rajae
item.description:
@Rajae wrote:

juju:

okay, i’ve heard of lots of people with this problem, what u need to do is get your windows repair cd, place it into your coffee cup holder and then reboot, when your machine starts up you can reinstall windows and get your machine working properly again.

Umm, no thanks, I’ve had worse experiences with windows than Linux. Since I have installed 7.10, I haven’t had this problem, but I want to know what it is.

Read full topic
